title: Content Structure in AkiraDocs
description: Learn how AkiraDocs organizes and processes documentation content
author: AkiraDocs Team

blocks.content: AkiraDocs follows a structured approach to organizing documentation files. All content is stored in the `/docs` directory with a logical hierarchy.

- /docs: Root documentation directory
- /docs/compiled: Processed documentation files
- /docs/[category]: Topic-based directories
- /docs/[category]/[page].json: Individual documentation pages
AkiraDocs supports both Markdown and MDX files which are automatically compiled into our JSON structure. This allows for flexible content authoring while maintaining structured data.

# Example.md
# My Heading

This is a paragraph.

```js
console.log('Hello');
```

1. Parse Markdown/MDX files
2. Convert to structured JSON format
3. Generate unique IDs for blocks
4. Apply metadata and formatting
5. Output to /docs/compiled directory
Meta files contain important information about your documentation pages including title, description, and SEO details.
